title: Blackened Chicken Recipe
description: Blackened chicken is a Cajun favorite, and this recipe is so easy. The blackening spice rub comes together in seconds, and the chicken sears in minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Meat and Poultry Chicken Baked and Roasted Chicken Breast Blackened Chicken 4.6 (1,129) 764 Reviews 73 Photos Blackened chicken is quick and easy to make at home. Adjust the spices in this recipe to suit your taste. This is great on a summer's day with fresh corn and mashed potatoes. Submitted by Karena Updated on November 12, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 73 73 73 73 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings ½ teaspoon paprika ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper ¼ teaspoon ground cumin ¼ teaspoon dried thyme ⅛ teaspoon onion powder ⅛ teaspoon ground white pepper ⅛ teaspoon salt 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves cooking spray Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat until it is smoking hot, about 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios While the skillet is heating, mix paprika, cayenne, cumin, thyme, onion powder, white pepper, and salt together in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spray chicken breasts on both sides with cooking spray, then coat evenly with spice mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chicken in the hot pan and cook for 1 minute. Turn, and cook 1 minute on other side. Transfer chicken to the prepared baking sheet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,637 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Blackened Chicken 01 of 73 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 73 Photo by  MommaBoyz418 01/23/2020 I followed the recipe as written, except I used leg quarters instead of chicken breasts. I also didn't have any cumin, but the hubby and the son loved the end results. 03 of 73 Photo by  MommaBoyz418 01/23/2020 I followed the recipe as written, except I used leg quarters instead of chicken breasts. I also didn't have any cumin, but the hubby and the son loved the end results. 04 of 73 Photo by  Bud Mc 01/06/2020 05 of 73 Photo by  Yabba 07/19/2019 Great combo of spices with a little heat. I don't like white pepper, so I substituted that with smokehouse black pepper. I also grilled it instead of the recommended directions. Delicious! I've since filled a shaker with it to have on hand. 06 of 73 Photo by  Thomas Ramy 07/15/2019 i added an fried onions on it and yes i'll make it again 07 of 73 Photo by  Christy Scronce 05/18/2019 08 of 73 Photo by  Laura 05/08/2019 09 of 73 Photo by  LaKokoLoko 04/09/2019 This is a great recipe! perfect mix of spices!!! 10 of 73 Photo by  LaKokoLoko 04/09/2019 This is a great recipe! perfect mix of spices!!! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Spicy Chicken Breasts 704 Ratings Gina's Lemon Pepper Chicken 210 Ratings Easy Garlic and Rosemary Chicken 239 Ratings Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings Paprika Chicken 28 Ratings Cinnamon Chicken 111 Ratings Indian Tomato Chicken 323 Ratings Braised Balsamic Chicken 4,634 Ratings Mediterranean Lemon Chicken 480 Ratings Jamaican Jerked Chicken 86 Ratings Lemon Pepper Cod 170 Ratings Chicken Ropa Vieja 23 Ratings Parchment Baked Salmon 95 Ratings Lucky's Quickie Chickie 291 Ratings Italian Chicken with Garlic and Lemon 181 Ratings Chicken in a Pot 620 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
